awd_titl_txt: An On-Line Control Technique for a Hierarchically           Structured Manufacturing Control System
awd_abstract_narration: The objective of this research is the development of a                          methodology for the repeated production of parts over the                       planning horizon of a shop.  The primary focus is the regulation                of parts flow among available resources utilizing real-time shop                and cell controllers which enable automation of the process.  The               shop controller dispatches batches of work parts and schedules                  them among cells.  The cell controller schedules a batch of parts               among workstations.  The fundamental analytical and design                      concepts underlying this approach are:  resource grouping, real-                time scheduling, hierarchical control, stability, and state-space               representation of the system.  The methodology includes a                       hierarchical decision/control structure consisting of shop and                  cell levels, dynamic grouping of a pool of resources (machines,                 robots, transporters) into virtual cells by the shop controller,                the use of minimax algebra to permit state-space representation                 of repeated discrete events, and implementation based on linear                 control theory.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation
